alert.note: Alert for San Luis Obispo County Beaches; Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued May 07 at 12:31PM PDT until May 07 at 5:00PM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 11 AM PDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 7 to 10 feet with dangerous rip currents. For the Beach Hazards Statement, dangerous rip currents and breaking waves due to elevated surf of 6 to 9 feet. * WHERE...San Luis Obispo County Beaches and Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches. * WHEN...For the High Surf Advisory, from 5 PM this afternoon to 11 AM PDT Sunday. For the Beach Hazards Statement, until 5 PM PDT this afternoon. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk for ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Large breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats near shore. There is an increased risk of ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Waves can wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats nearshore. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The wave heights will increase after 5 pm this afternoon to high surf criteria.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks. Remain out of the water due to hazardous swimming conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.

area.areaDesc: San Luis Obispo County Beaches; Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches
